content.description:
The first route established on the wall and the splitter looking dihedral you can catch a glimpse of from the road. There isn't an easy way to get to the top of this cliff so it was first climbed aid solo.

Starts with some interesting moves as you try to wiggle in a small cam in the seam. A couple thrutchy moves later and you get a good .3 placement. Continue up into the dihedral and get some good jams and locks higher up.

Shares anchors with Extrovert.
The first route you get to without having to do the approach pitch. Trad line, probably the most difficult at the Dihedral Wall.
content.location: Standing below the approach pitch, its to your left on a SE facing wall.

content.description: This super fun line takes you past a couple bolts on good crimps. Then look for a couple placements where you can slide in a .3 and .4 before clipping the third bolt and coming to a ledge. Continue up the steep dihedral and into the stembox just below the chains.
content.location: Look for the bolts to the right of Extrovert leading up towards a dihedral above a ledge.

content.description:
Start with some classic, barely there Koocanusa high stepping! Move past the pod and through the really cool mini roof moves to get into a crack system that takes you to the top.

Shares anchors with Solitude.
content.location: The face just right of Solitude dihedral.

content.description: Climb past 3 bolts with an optional piece before the second bolt. Then climb the wandering off fingers SPLITTER!! Keep an eye out for footholds on the face.
content.location: Left most line above the approach pitch.
